bibl.title: Letter from William D. Postell to Philip Showalter Hench, November 29, 1941

div1.p: Postell thanks Hench for furthering the interests of the library with Agramonte's daughter, and promises to see about having a photograph made of the memorial bas-relief.

div1.head: Letter from William D. Postell to Philip Showalter Hench, November 29, 1941
div1.opener:
LOUISIANA STATE UNIVERSITY B. A. & M. COLLEGE
ARISTIDES AGRAMONTE
MEMORIAL LIBRARY
LOUISIANA STATE UNIVERSITY
SCHOOL OF MEDICINE
NEW ORLEANS
November 29, 1941
Dr. P. S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Please accept my thanks and appreciation for what
you have done in attempting to further our interests with
Miss Agramonte. I certainly am going to see what I can do
towards having a photo made of the plaque, which you are so
anxious to obtain.

With best wishes and kindest personal regards, I
remain
div1.closer:
Cordially yours, W. D. Postell,
Librarian WDP:b
